body:
Comment 1: 
the first argument in the Args array is the name of the executable - this code makes
sure that if you haven't explicitly set the prefix for syslog that something appropriate
is shown.  If you've created a go executable called 'go-logger', and execute it from a
shell as:

    $ go-logger a b c

os.Args in this case will be ["go-logger", "a", "b", "c"].  If you don't explicitly set
a prefix for syslog, then it will use 'go-logger', which seems quite reasonable to me.
